channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There Is No Such Thing as an Independent Agency
item.description: The Supreme Court should overrule a 1935 precedent and put presidents back in charge of executing the law.

item.title: The Danger of Weight-Loss Drugs Going Mainstream
item.description: GLP-1s could help turn around America’s obesity epidemic. They could also bring about a new era of eating disorders for young women.

item.title: GOP lawmaker unveils bill to ensure fathers shoulder 50% of pregnancy expenses
item.description: Rep. Ashley Hinson has developed a package of bills aimed at helping new mothers financially navigate pregnancy and childbirth.

item.title: Target Of Leftist Lawfare Seeks To Remove Judge For ‘Judicial Misconduct’
item.description: Jim Troupis, Wisconsin attorney for the Trump campaign following the rigged 2020 election, is fighting a politically-driven prosecution.

item.title: There is a simple fix for America’s job-quality crisis: actually give workers a piece of the business

item.title: Nassau County Republican Bruce Blakeman to run for New York governor

item.title: Federal judge approves releasing Ghislaine Maxwell case grand jury material

item.title: When David Ellison was 13, his billionaire father Larry bought him a plane. He competed in air shows before leaving it to become a Hollywood executive

item.title: Right to Repair Would Help Consumers and Address ‘Affordability’

item.title: One Fire, One System: Hong Kong’s Fire Tragedy and the City That No Longer Exists
item.description: Hong Kong did not simply mishandle a tragedy; it demonstrated, once again, that it has become something fundamentally different from what it once was.

item.title: The low-hire, low-fire economy crawls along with job openings unchanged from September to October
item.description: Job openings have come down steadily since peaking at a record 12.1 million in March 2022. They were 7.7 million for both of the last two months.

item.title: Deutsche Bank and Jeffrey Epstein’s ghost
item.description: Given its long history of servicing high-risk clients, it is perhaps unsurprising that Deutsche Bank stepped in when Epstein was ditched by JPMorgan.
